column1: Goose Creek is a city in Berkeley County in the U.S. state of South Carolina. The population was 35
column2: 938 at the 2010 census. Most of the Naval Weapons Station Charleston is in Goose Creek. As defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Budget
column3: and used only by the U.S. Census Bureau and other Federal agencies for statistical purposes
column4: Goose Creek is included within the Charleston-North Charleston-Summerville metropolitan area and the Charleston-North Charleston Urbanized Area.

column1: Goose Creek is located in southern Berkeley County at 33°0′N 80°2′W (32.9955
column2: -80.0289). It is bordered to the east by the Cooper River and the Back River
column3: to the southeast by an outer portion of the city of Charleston
column4: to the southwest by the city of Hanahan and (farther to the west) the city of North Charleston in Charleston County
column5: and to the west by the unincorporated community of Ladson.

column1: Although the city of Goose Creek was established in 1961
column2: its history dates back many centuries. In the 1670s the Etiwan moved to the area to escape the Westo
column3: seeking protection among the plantations of early colonists who were often referred to as the "Goose Creek men"
column4: mostly settled a few miles north of Charleston near a stream called Goose Creek
column5: a tributary of the Cooper River. The Goose Creek men became leaders of the early Indian trade
column6: and by the 1690s many held important offices in the colonial government. At first the Goose Creek men dealt mainly in Indian slaves
column7: while later the deerskin trade dominated. Several colonial governors were Goose Creek men
column8: such as James Moore and Robert Daniell. Other prominent men included brothers Daniel and Pierre Bacot.The Otranto Plantation Indigo Vats and St. James Church are listed on the National Register of Historic Places.

column5: and Hanahan) are home to branches of the United States military. During the Cold War
column6: the Naval Base (1902–1996) became the third largest U.S. homeport serving over 80 ships and submarines. In addition
column7: the Charleston Naval Shipyard repaired frigates
column11: and submarines. The shipyard was also equipped for the refueling of nuclear subs.

The Goose Creek Police Department is housed at the Marguerite H. Brown Municipal Center
column2: along with the City Hall and Municipal Court
column3: and is an active department within the community of Goose Creek. The Goose Creek Police Department is a CALEA accredited agency and works to maintain a good relationship with the citizens using the community policing method.

column1: There are three high schools that serve the Goose Creek area. Goose Creek High School and Stratford High School serve students inside Goose Creek
column2: while Cane Bay High School is located outside Goose Creek city limits and serves students from both in and out of Goose Creek's city limits. Goose Creek High School is the home of the Berkeley County School of the Arts (BCA) Program.

column1: Goose Creek has a public library
column2: a branch of the Berkeley County Library System.
